creator: jeremycouillard
title: An artwork that stares back
description: This project describes how to create an artwork that can 'see' its viewers, take pictures of them, and tweet descriptions of them. It utilizes an mbed microcontroller, a camera, and a range finder to accomplish this.
steps: Acquire the necessary hardware: an mbed microcontroller, RJ45 ethernet jack and breakout board, a LinkSprite JPEG Color Camera, and a Maxbotix EZ1 range finder.
Connect the hardware components according to the mbed documentation and relevant libraries.
Write C++ code using the mbed environment to interface with the camera and range finder.
Implement the TwitPic library to enable the mbed to send images to Twitter.
Create a string array of descriptions to be used for the tweets.
Program the mbed to randomly select a description from the array and tweet it along with the image captured by the camera when someone is detected by the range finder.
Integrate the electronics into a piece of art. (Digital photo frame and steel paper clips are optional)
